definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: They had been reported by a well-known restaurateur.
sentences.chinese: 这些人都是被一位大富大贵的餐馆老板揭发的。

sentences.english: The truth is that there are few well-off Singaporean artists.
sentences.chinese: 但事实上新加坡的艺术家没几个是大富大贵的。

definition: to make easy money/to make a fortune/to line one's pockets
not having to worry about clothes and food (idiom)/to be provided with the basic necessities
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
to be successful in business/professional success
the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
to live comfortably/happy and prosperous life
glory, splendor, wealth and rank (idiom); high position and great wealth
